comments:
Driver:  0428I

In a new workspace, create a J2EE Web module targetting Tomcat, create a Java 
bean, right-click the Java bean and select "Create Web Service".  

On the 1st page, select "generate Proxy", "Monitor Web service" and "Test Web 
service", click Finish.

There's an exception:

This problem also occur if you Next through the wizard.

The problem does not occur if you go through the scenario a second time (i.e. 
the server already exist).

The serviceServiceInstancdId is null when CreateMonitorCommand is called.  
That's why the exception occurs.  I'm suspecting a data mapping issue.
Is this something we need to fix for M4?

Add correct mapping from ServerExtensionOutputCommand to CreateMonitorCommand.

I have the fix and have tested it out.

Found the problem.  We are not checking the status correctly when there's error 
in starting the server.

I've tested the fix and we are now reporting the problem with "ports in used".

Fix StartSeverCommand to correctly check for status when the server is not 
starting.  This would avoid the problem of calling Axis deploy when the server 
is actually having problem starting.
Last 2 comments are not meant to be for this defect.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
